name: World Thrift Day - Exploring Thrifting, Roots, and Circular Choices in Bengaluru
description:
This World Thrift Day (30th October), Enviu is bringing together voices from across Bengaluru for a meaningful conversation on thrifting — what it means, how it’s done, and why it matters in the journey toward circular fashion.
Hosted by Enviu, the event explores thrifting through diverse lenses. From a millennial who’s been thrifting long before it was a trend, to a Gen Z voice who blends sustainability with style, and an entrepreneur working to make thrifting accessible and mainstream, this conversation will unpack how this growing culture connects to both individual choice and systemic change.
Alongside insights and stories, the event will host a small thrift pop-up that encouraged participants to experience secondhand fashion firsthand. A space to share tried-and-tested thrifting practices, bust a few myths, and connect with others reimagining how we consume, reuse, and value clothes.
Through conversations like these, Enviu aims to highlight how everyday actions like choosing pre-loved can tie into broader efforts and build a circular future with platforms like Qilin. 
Enviu as a part of Saamuhika Shakti is creates solution to reduce textile waste and build inclusive, sustainable livelihoods.

name: Art Journaling Workshop - Workshop by Yukti Grover
description:
When was the last time you picked a colour just because it felt right? 🎨
If you don’t remember, this one’s definitely for you.
We’re slowing down for an evening of art journaling at Atta Galatta, where it’s not about being perfect but about playing with colours, textures, and feelings. You don’t need to bring anything—just your curiosity and an open mind. We’ve got all the materials, a cute postcard, and loads of good vibes waiting.
Come spend two hours creating, reflecting, and reconnecting with yourself.

name: Improv & Sketch Open Stage - An improv open mic
description:
No Pressure Improv returns with the Improv & Sketch Open Stage - think open mics, but for improv (and sketch)! Come watch Bengaluru's bubbling improv scene every month, and sign up if you will, to flaunt your improv on the Open Stage! 
Up to 8 performers who sign up are put together on the Open Stage to play improv together, led by the jam-master of the evening. This is a great opportunity to get stage time and to play improv in front of a kind and supporting audience, who will be alongside you as you improvise and discover the make-believe. 
40 minutes of Open Stage is followed by a featured act in the second half. Bring your ensemble or solo act, improv or otherwise - whether it's storytelling or stand-up or spoken word or your original set of songs - it's the perfect stage for you to experiment with your act or present it to the community.

name: Rapid Prototyping with AI: Build Faster. Ship Smarter. - AI Workshop by Roshan Mishra
description:
Most people can make AI-assisted demos, but few can ship production-ready apps. This workshop takes you through the complete lifecycle - from idea to high-quality prototype using real tools and real projects. Learn to turn messy ideas into clean specs, build production-grade apps with AI coding agents, and guide AI output like a senior engineer. Designed for backend engineers, frontend devs, PMs, and innovators who want to execute faster and smarter. Facilitated by Roshan Mishra, an applied researcher on AI systems.
Participants get 4M complimentary tokens to explore leading frontier models including GPT-5 and Claude Opus 4.1.

name: The Next Chapter - A book club for stories of renewal, purpose, and reinvention by Zuva Life
description: We continue exploring Strength to Strength by Arthur Brooks, a book that reframes success and fulfillment in the second half of life. We will discuss selected excerpts, so you’re welcome even if you haven’t read the book yet. Just show up with curiosity.

name: Land or Love? Book Reading and Discussion of Battle of Lands - Book Reading session
description:
Join us for an engaging morning at Atta Galatta, Bengaluru’s beloved bookstore and cultural space, as Vandita Mishra discusses her latest book, Battle of Lands.
Rooted in the complexities of Indian families, Battle of Lands explores how love, ego, and the pursuit of inheritance intertwine to leave scars that echo across generations. Through its layered narrative, the book reflects on relationships fractured by property disputes and the silent emotional wounds carried within families, asking readers to ponder what truly endures: land or love.
The session will be followed by an audience interaction and book signing.
Venue: Atta Galatta, Bengaluru
Date and Time: November 1st, 11:30 AM- 1:00 PM
Entry: Free

name: Children's Theatre Workshop - Theatre Workshop by Vikram Sridhar
description:
Theatre is a wonderful space for children to be themselves , overcome fear , build patience and respect , responsibility , communication and many more. Telling a Story , speaking to an audience , becoming a character ... all these and many more . The 3 hour acting workshop for children will take them through various fun filled activities and theatre games to bring out the performer in them.
Face : From Smiles to Anger to disgust , the children will explore their inner emotion and discover how the others react to us based on our expressions .
Body : From Gestures to Physical Movements , the children will explore the power and usage of Non verbal Communication in day to day drama
Voice : From Native Sounds to Language based speech , the children will explore how their voices can do magic in communication and confidence building . 
Simple Outcomes and Benefits
1) Expand their Communication skills with an audience 
2) Gain Self Confidence by interacting with new friends 
3) The joy of Creativity in acting and drama 
 
Limited to 15 children , we will discover various aspects of acting through drama and storytelling to audiences in a fun and learning way.

name: RANIs of INDIA: A Performance Storytelling - Storytelling by Vikram
description: RANIs of INDIA , Theatrical Storytelling Performance is a collection of lores from various oral and historical narratives of Queens who ruled different regions of the Country at various timelines collected based on numerous travel and research over the last few years on the lesser-known or completely forgotten women rulers of this country by Vikram Sridhar . Over one hour, through oral story-telling smattered with folk songs , we travel the country, going deeper into many stories of Indian queens from myths, history and present times, whose stories need to be told and heard. From North to South, East to West there have been women rulers/Queens/Ranis who`have changed and touched history strongly.

name: A STORY WALK through INDIRA NAGAR - Story Walk by Vikram Sridhar
description: On a Sunday morning , Walk through the lanes of INDIRA NAGAR with Vikram Sridhar discovering the lanes through the Folklore , Heritage and Ecology of the area . The walk will begin and culminate at ATTA GALATTA . The tales will revolve around historical , mythical and personal narratives weaved as we discover the area through the walk.

name: ONCE UPON A BRUNCH - Sunday morning brunch and stories by Vikram Sridhar
description:
Late weekend morning , brunch , stories like the ones from the olden times, meeting new people.
What if they all come together?
Weekend and late morning Brunch is an emotion . On the other hand, stories have always been an emotion too . What's common between the two is the rich heritage of food and stories. What if they come together?
Listen to these stories of the food as you enjoy your weekend Brunch set at a cozy location that has its own stories . A beautiful day starts with a lovely breakfast . And a morning with breakfast and stories . Every food we eat has a story to share .. Idli , Vada , bread , Paratha etc. Every breakfast comes after a long break and is eager to be eaten. A simple Weekend morning Brunch put together by Atta Galatta
Storytelling around the food lores by Vikram Sridhar

name: Harry Potter Book Discussion - Meetup by Sonali Bhatia
description:
For hard-core Potterheads age 12 and above!
Get into the minds of the characters, ferret out the intricacies of the plot - enter the wizarding world and share your thoughts and insights!
Will help if you have read all the Harry Potter books - this discussion will be based only on the books and not the movies.
The event is curated by Lahe Lahe Caravan and is being hosted at Atta Galatta.

name: Tarot & Intuition - An Afternoon of Insights
description:
Step into an afternoon of soulful reflection and intuitive discovery with Anuradha Shukla — celebrated Tarot reader, life coach, and author of “The Intuitive Edge: A DIY Tarot Guide for Smarter Decisions in Love and Business.”
In a world full of noise, this gathering offers a quiet, meaningful space to reconnect with your inner wisdom. Through the ancient art of tarot, Anuradha gently guides participants to explore their emotions, clarify decisions, and realign with life’s deeper flow.
The session will feature:
Personal Tarot Readings – short, insightful sessions offering clarity and direction
Reflections on Intuition – understanding how to listen to the voice within
Guided Conversations – linking tarot symbolism with everyday choices
Energy & Awareness Exercises – simple ways to ground and center yourself
Whether you seek answers about love, career, or personal growth, this event invites you to pause, reflect, and trust your intuition. The experience is designed to help you leave lighter, calmer, and more attuned to your own path.
Come with curiosity, stay with openness, and leave with a renewed sense of clarity.
Join us at Atta Galatta on 2nd November for an afternoon where spirituality meets insight — and where the tarot becomes a mirror to your soul.

name: Bebey’s Day Out - Book Discussion
description:
Step into the richly woven world of Bebey’s Day Out by Lakshmi C.V, where stories move
seamlessly across centuries, cities, and states of mind. From the bustling IT hubs of modern
India to the quiet cotton fields of the seventeenth-century Deccan, Lakshmi crafts tales that
explore the fragile boundaries between the ordinary and the extraordinary, the real and the
supernatural. Each story opens a window into a different world — one filled with love, loss, guilt,
and grace.
Populated with a memorable cast — from a spirited old lady to a weary housewife and a
restless teenager — this collection delves into the raw, unguarded emotions that make us
human. Told with insight, warmth, and gentle humour, Bebey’s Day Out is a celebration of life’s
unpredictability, reminding us that beneath every moment of chaos or calm lies a story waiting to
be told.
About the author
Lakshmi C.V. is a writer who delightfully blurs the lines between being a storyteller and a
homemaker — though she’s still deciding which came first. A Physics graduate from IIT with her
head often in the clouds but her feet firmly on the ground (also the name of her blog), Lakshmi
brings warmth, humour, and heart to everything she writes. Her journey as a writer began early,
with her first piece published in Eve’s Weekly while she was still in school.
Her stories have since appeared in Femina, Woman’s Era, Good Housekeeping, Today,
Women’s Web, and Readomania, among others. She has also written books for children and
contributed to anthologies like Airavata: Elephant Tales. When not lost in words, Lakshmi can be
found teaching, volunteering, or reading — always finding joy in the journey rather than the
destination.
She slips in and out of teaching mode without warning. It was quite a relief to her children when
she took up assignments as a volunteer with Teach India.
When she is not writing, she is reading for herself, and editing other people’s works.
For her, the journey is more interesting than the destination.
She lives in the NCR.

name: PlaySipConnect - An Interactive session by Shreya Yogway
description:
A space where you can truly be yourself — laugh freely, play like you did as a child, and connect beyond the usual small talk. Here, conversations flow from the heart, bonds are formed, and joy is shared in a safe, non-judgmental space. Let yourself just be, laugh, and enjoy the moment.
We’ll enjoy board games, group activities, and playful challenges that bring out your inner child — all while sipping a welcome drink.
🎲 Play • Sip • Connect by Shreya Yogway
📅 Sunday, 2nd November | 4–7 PM
📍 At Atta Galatta, Indira Nagar

name: Kannada Jamming - for Kannada Rajyotsava
description:
🎶 Aaroha the band Presents: Kannada Jamming for Kannada Rajyotsava 🎶 
 This Kannada Rajyotsava, let’s come together to celebrate the spirit, culture, and soulful music of Karnataka! 💛❤️ Join Aaroha the Band for a special Kannada Jamming Session – an evening dedicated to the melodies that define our land. From timeless classics to contemporary hits that echo across generations, Aaroha brings you a heartfelt musical journey in the language of our roots. 
✨ Highlights of the Event: 🎵 Soulful Kannada songs and unplugged renditions 🎤 Sing-along moments with the audience Let’s celebrate Kannada Rajyotsava not just with words, but with the universal language of music. Come, sing, sway, and feel the pride of being a Kannadiga! 
📅 Date: 2nd November 
 🕒 Time: 6pm to 7:30pm 
📍 Venue: Atta Galatta, Indiranagar 
 Let the beats of Karnataka’s heart resonate through every chord and every voice. Aaroha the Band invites you to be part of this musical tribute to Namma Kannada Nadu! 💛❤️

name: Unfollow the Trends - A workshop by Purnima & Suneyna
description: We scroll past countless trends every day, feeling the pressure to copy, perform, and fit in. Unfollow the Trends is a student-led workshop inviting you to explore what lies behind the scroll: your own authentic voice. It’s a space to pause, notice the stories only you can tell, and reimagine your digital identity. Sit, chat, and build your creative confidence together.

name: Pre-Bangalore Literature Festival Book Sale - AG’s Annual Blowout Sale
description:
Get ready, bookworms! The biggest book event of the year is here! AG’s Annual Blowout Sale, our massive Pre-Bangalore Literature Festival Book Sale, is your chance to stock up on incredible reads for less.
From Wednesday, November 5th, through Sunday, November 9th, 2025, you can enjoy a FLAT 50% OFF on absolutely all books!
Browse our bookstore and huge garage sale selection to discover literary treasures across every genre. Whether you're hunting for the best of Indian fiction, essential non-fiction reads, language books, or captivating children's books, everything is half-price!
Don't miss this five-day blowout event. Mark your calendars, tell your friends, and get ready to fill your shelves without emptying your wallet!

name: Pre-Bangalore Literature Festival Book Sale - AG’s Annual Blowout Sale
description:
Get ready, bookworms! The biggest book event of the year is here! AG’s Annual Blowout Sale, our massive Pre-Bangalore Literature Festival Book Sale, is your chance to stock up on incredible reads for less.

name: Girls Who Said Nothing & Everything - Book Signing by
description:
Author and activist Meera Vijayann will be in Bangalore this November for a special book signing event celebrating the release of her debut essay collection, Girls Who Said Nothing & Everything, published by Penguin Random House India. The event will take place on Thursday, 7th November at 3:30 PM at Atta Galatta, one of the city’s most beloved indie bookstores.
Vijayann’s collection features eleven deeply personal essays that explore the silences Indian women have been taught to maintain—at home, in relationships, and within themselves. Set in 1990s India, the essays delve into themes of girlhood, family, bodily autonomy, and the emotional inheritance of silence. With candour and nuance, the book speaks to the resilience it takes to find and reclaim one’s voice.
Based in Washington, Meera Vijayann has written extensively on gender, mental health, and social justice, with bylines in The Guardian, Forbes, Catapult, and Electric Literature. Her widely viewed TED talk on experiencing sexual assault as a young girl in India continues to resonate with audiences around the world.
The event offers readers a rare opportunity to meet the author in person and engage with her work, which is already being recognised as a bold and timely contribution to feminist literature

name: Tara Goes Aahhhhh! - Book Reading by Garima Gupta
description:
Facing Fears with Roars and Giggles! Ready for a story that doesn’t need words—just your eyes, your imagination, and all those big, bold feelings? Join Tara and her dino buddy on a wild, wordless adventure as they tackle their fears in the pop-up book Tara Goes Aahhhhh! with author Garima Gupta. It's a roar-some ride through emotions, courage, and friendship.
Age: 4-8, accompanied by a parent.

name: Pichwai Art Workshop - Art Workshop
description:
Let`s witness Lord Krishna and his leelas through an art form - Pichwai Art, Pichwai means backdrops, these paintings were used as backdrops mainly in Srinathji's sanctum.
It is a traditional art form that dates back to the 16th century from the city of Nathdwara, Rajasthan.
These paintings portray Srinath ji and his leelas through bright and vivid colors.
The paintings are a way for us to connect with the Lord Krishna.
This art is soul-satisfying and divine, another art form to start with your basic art skill.
You need no prior knowledge of drawing or painting in order to attend this workshop.
NO TRACING OR COPYING, You will be drawing on your own.
Srinathji will be taught in this workshop and some of the required basic pichwai motifs.

name: Pre-Bangalore Literature Festival Book Sale - AG’s Annual Blowout Sale
description:
Get ready, bookworms! The biggest book event of the year is here! AG’s Annual Blowout Sale, our massive Pre-Bangalore Literature Festival Book Sale, is your chance to stock up on incredible reads for less.
From Wednesday, November 5th, through Sunday, November 9th, 2025, you can enjoy a FLAT 50% OFF on absolutely all books!

Don't miss this five-day blowout event. Mark your calendars, tell your friends, and get ready to fill your shelves without emptying your wallet!

name: Flash Jam 8 - Sing and Jam with Strangers
description: We’re a one-day choir of amateur singers that get together, sing and harmonise and jam our hearts out! That's right, experience or skill level is no bar - if you want to learn about vocal harmony, or just have fun and sing in a community, this is the place for you! This time, we’ll be performing Chiquitita, by ABBA! So come join us for a fresh, memorable weekend session :)

name: Atta Galatta presents “AG Book Club” - Monthly Book Club with Palgun KJ
description: What have you been reading? Come, discuss your latest read. Each member gets 5-7 minutes to talk about the book, theme, plot, with 2 minutes to answer any questions others might have. This month’s special focus will be food- come tell us what you've been reading.

name: PaySlipConnect - Interactive Session by Shreya Yogway
description:
A space where you can truly be yourself — laugh freely, play like you did as a child, and connect beyond the usual small talk. Here, conversations flow from the heart, bonds are formed, and joy is shared in a safe, non-judgmental space. Let yourself just be, laugh, and enjoy the moment.
We’ll enjoy board games, group activities, and playful challenges that bring out your inner child — all while sipping a welcome drink.
🎲 Play • Sip • Connect by Shreya Yogway
📅 Saturday, 8th November | 4–7 PM
📍 At Atta Galatta, Indira Nagar

name: An Evening of Survivor & Protest Poetry, Feminism, and Healing - Book Launch by Nishita De
description:
Under the Jackfruit Tree is not just a book — it is a reclamation. An evening that bridges poetry and protest, music and memory, trauma and tenderness. Join Nish, poet and author of Under the Jackfruit Tree, for a one-hour immersive experience that intertwines survivor poetry, trauma stories, feminist reflections from the 90s, and a heartfelt journey of inner child healing.
This evening celebrates the voices that survived, the children who grew up too soon, and the communities that continue to rebuild themselves with love, dissent, and resilience.
Expect raw spoken word because healing, after all, is incomplete without unconditional love.
About the Book
Under the Jackfruit Tree: A Tribute to the Inner Child and a Chorale of Hope
is an unflinching collection of poems that unearth the layered histories of trauma, inheritance, and healing.
Nish writes with a voice that is both political and personal — a lyrical rebellion that meditates on the legacies of survival, feminism, and compassion.
Through six acts of poetry, the book journeys from childhood rupture to adult repair, culminating in an anthem of hope and defiance — a manifesto for those who have ever longed for gentleness in a brutal world.
About the Author
Nish is a Survivor and proud Thriver, a poet and community builder devoted to trauma healing, inner child work, and feminist storytelling.
She is also a tech product leader by profession, living in Bengaluru with her partner of 15 years and two beloved Indies.
Writing under her poetic identity Gargle in Grey, Nish believes in the power of a conscious community and the refusal of binaries — in life, love, and art.
This launch isn’t merely a literary event — it’s a social movement through verse.
Each reading becomes a protest, each poem a reclamation of language and tenderness from the jaws of trauma.
“Through my poems,” Nish says, “I speak to the ones who have survived in silence. This book is an ode to them — and to the children we once were, who kept us alive.

name: Coffee and Conversations - Group Meetup by The Listeners Circle
description:
What about some Filter Coffee and Unfiltered conversations on a fine Sunday morning?
Listeners Circle is an initiative to facilitate listening without judgment, hence giving a safe space for anyone to speak their heart out without the fear of judgment.
We at Listeners Circle are committed to building a community where there are no unsaid words, held back emotions and buried feelings because of the fear of being judged.
After 50+ Editions of Tell your Story, Listeners Circle relaunching a lighter format - Coffee and Conversations!
Coffee lightens us up. Coffee gives us clarity. Coffee refreshes up. Sip a coffee and speak your heart out without fear of judgment and listen without judging! Coffee is on us and the onus of conversation without judgment is on you.
Every word matters. Every emotion matters. Every feeling matters.
Think about how it would feel to take an hour out of your fast-paced life and share your experiences and thoughts to people who listen to you without judging over a cup of Coffee? Also, listen to others without judging.
Listeners` circle Coffee and Conversations -This is an event to make that happen.
Be a part of the Listener`s circle Coffee & Conversations - Edition 5.
Speak your mind without being judged. Speak your mind without any boundaries. No photography and videography without consent. Your stories stay within the four walls of the room and the hearts.
Would you like to just listen? We have a place for you too.
Book your passes in advance to avoid the last-minute sell outs.
Listeners Circle is an initiative to facilitate listening without judgment, hence giving a safe space for anyone to speak their heart out without the fear of judgment. We have done 50+ sessions over the last year, enabling people to voice their stories. Coffee & Conversations is our new format based on popular demand.

name: Pre-Bangalore Literature Festival Book Sale - AG’s Annual Blowout Sale
description:
Get ready, bookworms! The biggest book event of the year is here! AG’s Annual Blowout Sale, our massive Pre-Bangalore Literature Festival Book Sale, is your chance to stock up on incredible reads for less.
From Wednesday, November 5th, through Sunday, November 9th, 2025, you can enjoy a FLAT 50% OFF on absolutely all books!

Don't miss this five-day blowout event. Mark your calendars, tell your friends, and get ready to fill your shelves without emptying your wallet!

name: Divine Delicacies - Storytelling and Menu Tasting Session
description: Food is such an integral part of our lives that we cannot imagine any worship without food. Keeping this in mind, we welcome you to a unique experience where we shall serve you samples of prasadams from various temples and share stories of places of worship and the perceived food preferences of the divine. Join Aparna Jaishankar for Divine Delicacies, only at Atta Galatta.

name: Queer Quiet Hours -
description:
The next dates for Queer Quiet Hours are here!  Register here - http://bit.ly/adhdqueeple
Queer Quiet Hours is back — a cozy space to rest, make art, and just be. No pressure to talk, no need to perform. Just soft community vibes and gentle company. Bring your own project or come as you are. We'll have plenty of art stuff for you to use.
 
✨ For LGBTQIA+ folks only. We haven't opened it up to allies yet.
📅 9th November
Sunday, 2:00 - 5:00 PM
📍 @attagalatta, Indiranagar, Bangalore
🆓 Free to join. Limited spots ( Sign up)
📸 No photos taken without clear consent.

name: Haiku Echoes, a collaboration of haiku and storytelling - In collaboration with Lavanya Prasad Conceptualised by Kala Ramesh
description:
Step into the delicate world of haikai poetry at Haiku Echoes, a 90-minute taster session celebrating the beauty of brevity and the power of pause. Conceptualised by renowned haiku poet Kala Ramesh, this evening brings together ten distinguished voices from the haiku community.
The line-up includes Anju Kishore, Devoshruti Mandal, Kavita Ratna, Namratha Varadarajan, Shloka Shankar, Tapan Mozumdar, Teji Sethi, Vani Sathyanarayan, Vinay R. Leo, and Kala Ramesh. Through evocative readings and enactments, and a special visual presentation of haiku by actor Lavanya Prasad, the event promises a unique and immersive poetic experience.
📅 Date: 14 November 2025
🕒 Time: 6:00 PM to 7:30 PM
📍 Venue: Atta Galatta, Bengaluru
This gathering invites poetry lovers, new and seasoned, to listen, feel, and echo the quiet power of haiku.

name: Step into the world of junk journaling - Junk Journaling workshop by Deepa Rao
description:
As the saying goes, one man’s trash is another man’s treasure! Junk journaling is described as a  sustainable craft that revolves around using whatever recycled materials or old scraps you have, to create a personalised journal. This therapeutic hobby is perfect for seasoned journalers who want to experience a new form of journaling and even for fresh beginners who want to start journaling themselves!
In this 2-hour session, you will learn the basics of junk journaling, which include making journals out of old paper bags, learning how to make personalised art out of scrap, and so much more! A basic starter kit is included in this workshop to help you get right to the fun stuff.
I am Deepa, step into the world of Junk and Visual journaling with me for a fun junk journaling session that will help you turn something drab into something fab!

name: The Bougainvillea Circle - Connection Circle by Radhika Ghose
description:
"Sawubona" a Zulu Greeting meaning, "We See You". At Bougainvillea Circles you are offered a space to be heard, seen, welcomed as you are. A non-judgmental, safe, trusted space where you are free to be all that you want to be. Nothing More, Nothing less. No Restrictions, no judgements, just an intimate group of people looking for a space to be real. A space where we`re all less alone for a little while. Where we are seen, how we want to be seen. Conversations, Connections, Community of Compassion. All that makes the world go round, after Love of course!
Remember - Sawubona: We See You.

name: The Long and Short of Haiku - An intensive haikai workshop with Kala Ramesh
description:
Haiku may be short, but it can hold a world of meaning. In this masterclass, Kala Ramesh will guide participants through the beauty, rules, and craft of this unique form of poetry.
“What is Haiku”- exploring and understanding the masters through a PowerPoint presentation. A lot of interaction will be included, encouraging each participant to become more involved and engage with this minimalistic form of poetry in a more compelling way. Like all Japanese art forms, haiku is full of rules – though we don’t call them that! The art of writing haiku will be gradually introduced. The ‘kire’ or ‘cut’, which is so important to haiku, will be taught. Certain key Japanese aesthetics will also be introduced. Homework will be assigned.
16th November: Haiku assigned as homework will be discussed. The class progresses into an in-depth study of the masters, both old and new. A brief introduction to haibun (prose embedded with haiku), tanka (a 1300-year-old lyrical poem), and haiku (artwork with haiku) will be provided.

name: Mahabharata Stories in Bengaluru - Storytelling by Aparna Jaishankar
description: The Mahabharata is a living epic that thrives amongst us.  If so, what about Bengaluru? What stories live in this city in the form of art, architecture, rituals, and landscape. Join Aparna Jaishankar for an oral storytelling performance, as she shares a few episodes from the Mahabharata that one might have seen and experienced in the city of Bengaluru.

name: The Long and Short of Haiku - An intensive haikai workshop with Kala Ramesh
description:
Haiku may be short, but it can hold a world of meaning. In this masterclass, Kala Ramesh will guide participants through the beauty, rules, and craft of this unique form of poetry.
“What is Haiku”- exploring and understanding the masters through a PowerPoint presentation. A lot of interaction will be included, encouraging each participant to become more involved and engage with this minimalistic form of poetry in a more compelling way. Like all Japanese art forms, haiku is full of rules – though we don’t call them that! The art of writing haiku will be gradually introduced. The ‘kire’ or ‘cut’, which is so important to haiku, will be taught. Certain key Japanese aesthetics will also be introduced. Homework will be assigned.
16th November: Haiku assigned as homework will be discussed. The class progresses into an in-depth study of the masters, both old and new. A brief introduction to haibun (prose embedded with haiku), tanka (a 1300-year-old lyrical poem), and haiku (artwork with haiku) will be provided.

name: Food In Literature - Monthly Book Club
description:
Our emotions and memories are intrinsically related to the food we eat and the genre of food
literature combines them in a way that helps us connect not only to our past and our present, to 
different cultures, and communities, values and rituals, events both life-changing and mundane but to 
each other as well. 
So, if viewing the world through the lens of food and literature interests you, then join us for a 
dialogue on “Food in Literature” and to celebrate those stories and their diversity. Each month with 
Prachi Grover, we read our way through several powerful (and delicious) narratives.
November Read: Kitchen Confidential by Anthony Bourdain
We assure you that you will enjoy every single bite!
The session is free but registration is a must as we have limited spots available. 
Prachi Grover is a culinary consultant and educator and is the founder of “From Words to Wok”; a 
community for people who to love to read and eat!
When: Saturday, 22nd November, 2025 at 11 a.m.
Where: Atta Galatta Bookstore, Indira Nagar
Ages: 18+
Registration is mandatory: https://t.ly/BO6wV 
Copies of the book are available at the store.

name: Let Poetry Be - Poetry Open Mic
description:
This monthly gathering will see poetry coming to life, through reading, music, art and any other forms of artistic expression, at Atta Galatta. Listeners and performers are all welcome!
Date: 22nd November
Time: 4pm 
Venue: Atta Galatta, Indiranagar
Event specifics & submission guidelines –
1. Theme - Free Verse (any original work)
2. Works can be original or of other poets, performed live
3. All languages welcome
4. Participants can read to music (acoustic instrument/s), dramatise, use props & costumes
5. Each participant will enjoy 5 minutes of reading time
6. Kindly submit your poem and name to letpoetrybe@gmail.com on or before 20th Nov midnight. WE WILL NOT ACCEPT ATTACHMENTS OR LINKS. SUBJECT OF YOUR MAIL MUST READ AS 'Entry for-November LPB meet-up'
7. You may also send entries that are not related to the theme
8. The event will begin at 4pm sharp and will be held at Atta Galatta. Participants to report not later than 3:45 pm to hear about performance order and meet the host
9. For any further clarifications, write to us at letpoetrybe@gmail.com
You are now welcome to flood our inbox!

name: Step Into The World of Junk Journaling  - Junk Journaling workshop by Deepa Rao
description:
As the saying goes, one man’s trash is another man’s treasure! Junk journaling is described as a  sustainable craft that revolves around using whatever recycled materials or old scraps you have, to create a personalised journal. This therapeutic hobby is perfect for seasoned journalers who want to experience a new form of journaling and even for fresh beginners who want to start journaling themselves!
In this 2-hour session, you will learn the basics of junk journaling, which include making journals out of old paper bags, learning how to make personalised art out of scrap, and so much more! A basic starter kit is included in this workshop to help you get right to the fun stuff.
I am Deepa, step into the world of Junk and Visual journaling with me for a fun junk journaling session that will help you turn something drab into something fab!

name: stE=mc² - Stem Workshop with Madhuri Katti
description:
Join in for an interactive experiment-led science session by physics educator and writer Madhuri Katti and some of her students. The goal of the session is to show young students and adults a different and engaging way of thinking about science, history of scientific ideas and its effects on everyday life, by exploring fundamental topics via simple home-experiments. The experiments will be of three parts:
- Fun with Forces: Explanation of the four fundamental forces of nature, and their effects. Demonstration of experiments with gravity and static electricity. 
- Magnets and Motors : construction of a simple motor with a battery, magnet, and copper wire. Discussion of electricity and magnetism.
- Playing with fluids: demonstrations of dynamics of fluids involving surface tension, and diffusion. Light along with Fluids.
At the end, we hope to inspire the participants to be boldly curious and to recognise the importance of science in our everyday lives.

name: The Stray Dogs of Landour Network: A True Story by a Failed Dog Trainer - Book Launch by Lalitha Krishnan
description:
Lalitha Krishnan will introduce her new memoir in an interactive session. Released earlier this year, the book is available in both print and e-book formats on Amazon, Pothi.com, and Flipkart. It is a testament to the profound lessons of compassion, resilience, and belonging taught by free-ranging dogs.
The story begins in Landour, where Krishnan, a newly certified dog trainer fighting battles of her own, encounters a troubled stray named Pretty on her doorstep. With a training manual in hand, she intends to help Pretty find a home. But Pretty has a different plan, and with quiet intelligence, she leads Krishnan into her world, introducing her to her pup and the rest of the pack.
Inspired by the philosophy of Ubuntu (“I am because we are”), Krishnan finds herself feeding, training, and caring for a growing network of dogs in an international neighbourhood. In doing so, she begins to heal, learning that her canine companions have as much to teach her as she has to teach them. The dogs, with their innate wisdom and social dynamics, reshape Krishnan’s understanding of love and survival.
The Stray Dogs of Landour Network: A True Story by a Failed Dog Trainer features a foreword by the late travel writer Bill Aitken, who also contributed a chapter titled “Mussoorie Dogs and Dog Lovers I Love.” Krishnan recounts stories shared by authors Stephen Alter and Ganesh Saili, both residents of Landour. Her book is a tribute to the silent, unseen lives of the animals who share our world and the emotional truths they awaken within us.
Review:
“The Stray Dogs of Landour Network is a deeply personal, unflinchingly honest memoir that sits comfortably on the shelf alongside Helen Macdonald’s H Is for Hawk or Sy Montgomery’s The Soul of an Octopus. It is a story of survival, not just of dogs, but of people finding grace in the act of caring without conditions. 
A poignant, slow-blooming debut that blends environmental awareness with emotional depth. Lalitha Krishnan’s voice is one of rare integrity, grounded, observant, and quietly radical in its compassion.”
 — The Literature Today
About the Author:
Lalitha Krishnan is a writer, podcaster, potter, and nature documenter based in Ranikhet in the Indian Himalaya. Her work explores the bonds between humans, animals, and the natural world. A certified dog trainer, Krishnan is passionate about dogs and wildlife and has contributed to publications including Dogs & Pups Magazine, Garhwal Post, RoundGlass Sustain, and Sanctuary Asia, among others.
